column4: hey guys i have  a ebook that is a .exe and uses ebook viewer. I can open it under wine however when i click on chapters It does not open. I dunno what is wrong so I thought about extracting the .exe. However, I have had trouble extracting .exe. I've tried cabextract, p7zip and unshield
where did you get it from?
if it's some obscure executable, try it in wine.... but i'm no expert
i ran it in wine. However it opens the home page of ebook. When i click on chapters then it does not load anything but a blank page
did it open in a browser or something?
no, it uses a app called ebook viewer
problem with "ebook viewer" is that it's very generic :P
i would be happy by either viewing the book or extracting .exe to look at files
just a sec, i'm taking a look
want a link to the source? u can download and see it?
it appears as though your ebook viewer program requires IE
what I would do is install ie6 and gecko using winetricks (http://wiki.winehq.org/winetricks)
yeah, what i said and what kostkon said are equivalent
what version of wine are you using?
they won't give you any help if you're running 1.0, it's soooo old
